pr_title: [RISK=LOW][No ticket] Removing null constraint from User table column creation and modified time

timeline.message: Making creation and modified time null

timeline.bodyText: why is this being set now?
timeline.author: ericsong

replies.bodyText: This has been made required for user by RDR. this is NOT part of this PR it just got sneaked in. I can revert this and make a new PR for this
replies.author: NehaBroad

replies.bodyText:
I think that may be better even if its a small change since I have a lingering comment about its implementation.
That comment being, how do we know this value can be set to "ACTIVE"? IIRC, firecloud can return a value for the NO_ACCESS role.
replies.author: ericsong

replies.bodyText: Thats because as of now for RDR we are going with assumption that all the USERS are active until we introduce an official way of removing users from workbench
replies.author: NehaBroad

replies.bodyText:
I see. It does seem a bit odd that we would send over "ACTIVE" for disabled users but if that's what they want ¯_(ツ)_/¯.
Maybe add a comment saying we should set this dynamically when we do start removing users from workbench?
replies.author: ericsong

replies.bodyText: Is there a separate notion of RDR_ACTIVE from WORKBENCH_ACTIVE?
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: are we ok with hitting the RDR multiple times with the same user account? As is, I believe a user will keep getting sent until they log in and their lat_modified_time gets set.
timeline.author: ericsong
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -12,7 +12,7 @@
       nativeQuery = true,
       value =
           "select u.user_id from user u LEFT JOIN rdr_export rdr on"
-              + " u.user_id = rdr.export_id and rdr.entity_type = 1 where "
+              + " u.user_id = rdr.export_id and rdr.entity_type = 1 where u.last_modified_time is null or "

replies.bodyText: Actually i am going to push change to set the  value of  last_modified_date time as either today's date or first_sign in just so it is picked  only the first time
replies.author: NehaBroad

timeline.bodyText: unrelated but we should try to avoid native queries wherever possible since our test db and production db are different.
timeline.author: ericsong

replies.bodyText: Since rdr_export doesn't have ENTITY_ID as a foreign key (since it can contain either WORKSPACE  or USER id) i was unable to use it the using Db classes.
replies.author: NehaBroad

timeline.bodyText: This feels misplaced. If the issue is that last_modified_time isn't getting updated when the user is saved, I think we should really be changing that value up within the UserServiceImpl.updateUserWithRetries method, which is where all user-modifying changes funnel through. And then this method should probably call updateUserWithRetries instead of userDao.save.
timeline.author: gjuggler

replies.bodyText: Can we use the updated updateUserWithRetries method to avoid setting this here?
replies.author: ericsong

timeline.bodyText:
It's super surprising to see this conversion code take a null value from the DB and set it to the current timestamp in the RDR export call. I'm still kind of scratching my head about this... what's the motivation behind this choice? Is the RDR API unwilling to accept null values? Are they okay with receiving data about researchers whose creation time is constantly changing?
This absolutely needs some comment in the code explaining why we are making a somewhat-surprising choice.
timeline.author: gjuggler

replies.bodyText: I will add comments about this, right now i wanted to solve the creation_date issue with liquibase just so it unblocks the test build.
replies.author: NehaBroad

timeline.message: update user lastModifiedTime on userRetries method
spotless and comments for future action

timeline.bodyText:
the user modifier function should only contain code to update the user object.
Otherwise, everything else will be run multiple times with the retries. In this case, the data use agreement will be created several times.
timeline.author: ericsong
